articles.headline: Estée Lauder Agrees to Buy Tom Ford Brand in $2.8 Billion Deal
articles.snippet: Tom Ford’s high-end fragrances routinely make best-seller lists, and the deal, the luxury industry’s biggest this year, also brings apparel to Estée Lauder, which had been strictly focused on beauty.
articles.abstract: Tom Ford’s high-end fragrances routinely make best-seller lists, and the deal, the luxury industry’s biggest this year, also brings apparel to Estée Lauder, which had been strictly focused on beauty.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tom Ford — designer, film director, art collector and fashion world provocateur — can now add one more accolade to his list: billionaire. On Tuesday, Estée Lauder announced it had agreed to buy his company in a deal that totaled $2.8 billion.
articles.byline: By Vanessa Friedman and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: FTX’s In-House Performance Coach Is Just as Surprised as You Are
articles.snippet: George K. Lerner, a psychiatrist who has worked at the collapsed crypto exchange FTX since last year, said he had no knowledge of wrongdoing at the firm.
articles.abstract: George K. Lerner, a psychiatrist who has worked at the collapsed crypto exchange FTX since last year, said he had no knowledge of wrongdoing at the firm.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the week since the onetime billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried became the business world’s biggest villain, many of his friends, associates and investors have gone quiet, either out of embarrassment or on the advice of their lawyers.

articles.headline: Top Republicans Face Dissent as McCarthy Wins G.O.P. Nod for Speaker
articles.snippet: Even as Representative Kevin McCarthy, the minority leader, survived his first test, he lacked the votes to cement the speakership. His Senate counterpart also faced a challenge to his position.
articles.abstract: Even as Representative Kevin McCarthy, the minority leader, survived his first test, he lacked the votes to cement the speakership. His Senate counterpart also faced a challenge to his position.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Republican leaders in Congress are confronting fresh threats to their power and divisions in their ranks from an emboldened and embittered right flank, after a weaker than expected midterm election performance that has demoralized their party.
articles.byline: By Catie Edmondson and Emily Cochrane

articles.headline: Poland Suggests Russian-Made Missile Killed 2 Inside Its Borders
articles.snippet: The explosion in a Polish village across the border from Ukraine occurred as Russia bombarded Ukrainian cities with about 100 missiles.
articles.abstract: The explosion in a Polish village across the border from Ukraine occurred as Russia bombarded Ukrainian cities with about 100 missiles.
articles.lead_paragraph: KYIV, Ukraine — Poland said early Wednesday that an explosion that killed two people at a grain-processing plant near the Ukrainian border had “most likely” been caused by a Russian-made missile, raising the prospect that the NATO alliance would be drawn more directly into the war in Ukraine.
articles.byline: By Marc Santora and Maria Varenikova

articles.headline: A Parade of Tankers Has Eased Europe’s Energy Crisis
articles.snippet: Chilled gas from the United States has helped replace fuel from Russia, upending European energy markets.
articles.abstract: Chilled gas from the United States has helped replace fuel from Russia, upending European energy markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: The lights in Europe are being kept on by giant ships sailing from ports in Louisiana and Texas.

articles.headline: Inflation in Britain Reaches 11.1 Percent, Led by Energy Costs
articles.snippet: Prices in October rose at the fastest rate in more than 40 years, deepening the country’s cost-of-living crisis.
articles.abstract: Prices in October rose at the fastest rate in more than 40 years, deepening the country’s cost-of-living crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Britain’s cost-of-living crisis deepened in October, as consumer prices surged 11.1 percent from a year earlier, the highest in more than 40 years, granting no relief to households struggling to keep up with large increases in the price of food, heating and gas.

articles.headline: They Called Him a Gangster Out for Revenge. The Evidence? 6 Text Messages.
articles.snippet: A murder-conspiracy case in northwestern England tells the story of Britain’s crackdown on gangs, which disproportionately targets young Black men.
articles.abstract: A murder-conspiracy case in northwestern England tells the story of Britain’s crackdown on gangs, which disproportionately targets young Black men.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ademola Adedeji tried to picture what the jury saw when they looked at him.

articles.headline: How to Prepare for Life After Twitter
articles.snippet: Don’t delete your account just yet. Elon Musk’s takeover can teach us valuable lessons about our relationship with social networks.
articles.abstract: Don’t delete your account just yet. Elon Musk’s takeover can teach us valuable lessons about our relationship with social networks.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sheer chaos has surrounded Elon Musk’s takeover of Twitter over the past few weeks. More than half of Twitter’s employees have been fired or have resigned. The verification system no longer means much. And some users have reported problems with security features. So if you have an account on the social network, what do you do?

articles.headline: Engineers From Taiwan Bolstered China’s Chip Industry. Now They’re Leaving.
articles.snippet: The lure of money and new opportunities enticed talent to work in China’s semiconductor plants. The looming Cold War in tech changed the calculus.
articles.abstract: The lure of money and new opportunities enticed talent to work in China’s semiconductor plants. The looming Cold War in tech changed the calculus.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAIPEI, Taiwan — The job offer from a Chinese semiconductor company was appealing. A higher salary. Work trips to explore new technologies.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez, Amy Chang Chien and John Liu

articles.headline: Elon Musk Tells a Court He Had Little Say in His Giant Tesla Pay
articles.snippet: The billionaire chief executive testified about a multibillion-dollar compensation package the electric car company’s board put in place in 2018.
articles.abstract: The billionaire chief executive testified about a multibillion-dollar compensation package the electric car company’s board put in place in 2018.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elon Musk testified on Wednesday that he was not involved in the discussions among Tesla board members about a 2018 pay package that granted him billions of dollars in stock options, helping to make him the world’s richest person.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing, Isabella Simonetti and Peter Eavis
